title: What are some ancient inventions that are much better than modern technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Modern Technology started about the mid 20th Century is first now catching up with now commonly misnomered “Astrology” from about 5000 years ago to about 500 years ago. HOW they “knew” what ‘rays’ reach ‘here’ at what times, will likely never be published since those ‘secrets’ were among the millions of things burnt by each successive “Empire” in their “eradication” of “obsolete” and “superstitious” and “forbidden” and “treasonous” materials throughout time. I DOUBT Confucius may have any insight to ‘Astrology’, but he was NEVER any FAVORITE Author of HIS OWN Contemporary Government NOR Any great hero to any of the successors for Thousands of years; his stuff was burnt in PUBLIC Bonfires continuously, the results being a grand total of about a dozen ANNOTATED “8 and a half by eleven pages” THAT REMAIN Of his works, along with hundreds of other such doomed contributors. Similarly, the “lore” that remains of “star gazers” “predicting” things from as simple as “the weather” and “natural disasters” to the more curious “not a conspiracy” of “timing” for “successful” and “unsuccessful” “Ventures” may HAVE BEEN mere ridiculous curiosities at the beginnings of each new successive “enlightenment”, But by the 1960s “A.D.”, things like “solar flares” became “common knowledge”, and have even led to intriguing “stay indoors” “health warnings”. As “modern technology” becomes more able to identify more “effects” of more “elemental” “impacts and influences”, an HONEST Mind won’t be quite so able to simply write-off some of those older “taken for granted” “metaphysical laws” that became INCONVENIENT to Commercial Interests, and those very descendants of those Previously Destructive Interests have, and will continue to, “Discover” “New” things their predecessors spent great time and blood to obliterate from history.

Better is of course highly subjective, but I can think of a couple: If I told you I’d made a digital camera which didn’t need batteries, and rather than worry about “full frame” or “APS-C” or whatever, you just cut out a sensor at the size you wanted, you probably wouldn’t believe me, but that’s what photographic film is. Obviously digital is cheaper and easier, but I’m not really convinced it’s actually a better technology than photographic film.Books. If I have a book, I can lend it out, it never runs out of battery, it’s incredibly resistant to damage, and it can have full colour photos in it. I’ve had a Kindle and a Kobo, eBook readers are pretty awful compared to regular books. I think the screens would be amazing in a smartphone, easily visible in bright sunlight, and very low power consumption, I’d buy that in an instant, but for me, eBook readers are a very poor alternative to the paper book, except maybe for people who need the ability to increase font size or something.I think in lots of cases, the Internal Combustion Engine is better technology than an electric car. Charge times are far too long, and with an ICE, I can just carry charge with me, I can have a canister of petrol or diesel strapped to the back of a 4x4.
